Class TripPoint

java.lang.Object
TripPoint
public class TripPoint extends Object
Has multiple setters and getters to manipulate the private fields. Reads trip.csv files to then calculate haversine distances.
Version:
1.1

      public int getTime()
      ints are mutable, this getter returns a copy to maintain encapsulation.
      Returns:
      --> gives back a copy of time

      doubles are mutable, this getter returns a copy to maintain encapsulation.

      --> gives back a copy of latitude is given

      doubles are mutable, this getter returns a copy to maintain encapsulation.
      Returns:
      --> gives back a copy of longitude

    • getTrip

      public static ArrayList<TripPoint> getTrip()
      Creates a copy of the trip array to maintain encapsulation, no memory addresses are given away by calling this method.
      Returns:
      -> gives back a copy of the trip

    • haversineDistance

      public static double haversineDistance(TripPoint a, TripPoint b)
      Uses TripPoints to pull out lon and lat. Then converts from degrees to radians, then inputs them into the haversine distance formula.
      Returns:
      --> gives back the arc distance in km

    • avgSpeed

      public static double avgSpeed(TripPoint a, TripPoint b)
      Calculates the average speed using distance/time in hours. Uses Math.abs to work in any TripPoint order.
      Parameters:
      a - --> any TripPoint
      b - --> any TripPoint
      Returns:
      --> gives back the avgspeed in km/hr

    • totalTime

      public static double totalTime()
      totalTime() adds all the numbers up from the trip and divides by 60.0 to return a proper double for the total time.
      Returns:
      --> total time as a double

    • totalDistance

      public static double totalDistance()
      Loops through the trip to get all points, then calls haversineD to get all the distances, then finally rounds at the end
      Returns:
      --> gives back the properly rounded total distance

    • readFile

      public static void readFile(String filename)
      This method is what creates the actual "trip" ArrayList. First it reads the file, then it will assign the values to the correct variables for the class by calling the TripPoint() method. parsedTime --> Extracted time from the file reader parsedLat --> Extracted Latitude from the file reader parsedLon --> Extracted Longitude from the file reader
      Parameters:
      filename - --> name of the file being read "triplog.csv"

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Copied the test case data from TripPointTest
      Parameters:
      args -
